news_header: Bangladesh issues arrest warrants for Sheikh Hasina and 45 others over summer protests resulting in hundreds of deaths.
news_text: Hasinan and his assistants face charges related to hundreds of deaths during the summer protests in Bangladesh. An arrest warrant has been issued for Minister Sheikh Hasina and 45 others, including close aides, for crimes against humanity during the July-August protests. Prosecutor B.M. Sultan Mahmud stated that the group is accused of escalating violence that led to the deaths of protesters. Hasina is required to appear in court on November 18. The protests, which began in July, called for the dissolution of the state system criticized for favoring government supporters, resulting in at least 300 fatalities. Hasina left for India on August 5 amid allegations of human rights violations, including mass arrests of political opponents.
